tasks.title: DD6. Triage
tasks.description:
- Determine Impact
- Determine Scope 
    - Number of Documents / Records
    - Number of Clients
    - Number of Company Entities
    - Number of Individuals
- Send Communincation
- Determine if False Positive

tasks.title: DA4. Malware
tasks.description: If **Malware** was involve in the incident refer to the [Malware Playbook](https://github.com/socfortress/Playbooks/tree/main/IRP-Malware)

tasks.title: DA11. Technical Help
tasks.description:
If the Incident Commander feels we need Technical help or ressources to handle the incident he can reach out to our Incident Response Partner.  
We have a retainer with the following company and we can reach them at : xxxx@yyy.com or 555-555-5555

tasks.title: DA12. Legal Help
tasks.description:
If there are Legal implication such as
- GDPR
- Criminal Charges
- Regulation
- Laws

tasks.title: DA14. Root Cause Analysis
tasks.description:
Identify how this incident happened. 
- Phishing Emails
- Voice Phishing
- Drive-by Download
- Vulnerability
    - Remote Code Execution
    - Cross-Site Scripting
- Remote Services
    - Default / Weak Password
    - Brute Force
    - Vulnerability
- Lost Device
- Human Error

tasks.title: DA15. Send Communincation
tasks.description:
Contact any relevant of the following party
- Internal Security Team
- Affected Clients
- Any internal teams needed for remediation or counselling

tasks.title: DR3. Update Defenses
tasks.description:
Determine which of the following rules needs to be removed and which needs to stay in the following list:  
- Firewall Rules
- EDR 
    - Ban hashes
    - Ban domains
    - Containment
- Proxy Block
- DNS Sinkhole
- Etc.

tasks.title: DD2. Indentify Risks Factors
tasks.description:
#### Common
- Credential Theft
- Device Loss
    - Laptop
    - Phone
- Criminal Activites
    - Blackmail / Ransom

#### Company Specific
- Reputation Damage
- Financial Losses
    - Lost of conctrat
    - Contract not renewed
    - Lower bid to our clients
    - Fines
        - Regulation

tasks.title: DA9. External Help
tasks.description: Does Company have all the knowledge and ressources to handle the crisis alone?

tasks.title: DC12. Close Monitoring
tasks.description:
- Monitor for 
    - New information leaked
    - New communication from Attackers
    - People trying to give back device(s)/document(s)

tasks.title: DC13. All Affected Data Lost Addressed?
tasks.description: If all affected data have been addressed, you can go to the [Recover phase](https://github.com/socfortress/Playbooks/tree/main/IRP-DataLoss#5-recover), otherwise continue bellow.

tasks.title: DR2. Vulnerability Scan
tasks.description:
Perform:  
- External VA
- If possible
    - Authenticated scan
    - Agent base scan

tasks.title: DR4. Restore Service
tasks.description:
Depending on the containment applied to the host, perform all the following that applies:  
- Lift containment in EDR console
- Move host to production VLAN
- Enable switch port
- Enable/Create virtual network interface
- etc.

tasks.title: DR1. Rebuilt Systems
tasks.description:
In an isolated environment:  
    - Install 
        - Supported OS
        - Security solutions
        - Up to date applications
    - Restore data (from a clean backup)

tasks.title: DA3. Identify IOCs
tasks.description:
- Data
    - All Files Lost
    - Records Stolen
    - MFA Token
    - Credentials
    - PII
- Validate hashes
    - [VirusTotal](../Tools/README.md#virus-total)
    - [Hybrid Analysis](Tools/README.md#hybrid-analysis)
- Validate links
    - [VirusTotal](../Tools/README.md#virus-total)
    - [Hybrid Analysis](../Tools/README.md#hybrid-analysis)
    - [URLScan](../Tools/README.md#urlscan)
- ID other addresses, domains, IPs
    - [VirusTotal](../Tools/README.md#virus-total)
    - [Hybrid Analysis](../Tools/README.md#hybrid-analysis)
    - [Talos Intelligence](../Tools/README.md#hybrid-analysis)
- Search Threat Intel sources
    - [VirusTotal](../Tools/README.md#virus-total)
    - [Hybrid Analysis](../Tools/README.md#hybrid-analysis)
    - [Talos Intelligence](../Tools/README.md#hybrid-analysis)
- Disk forensics on recipient's endpoint

tasks.title: DD4. Categorize
tasks.description:
Determine type of Data Loss we are dealing with.
- Cyber Threat
- Insider Threat
- Mail Sent to Wrong Destination
- Device Lost
    - Laptop
    - Phone
- Printed Documents

tasks.title: DC7. Data Posted to the Internet
tasks.description: If the site is controlled by an public company, we can ask them to remove the information. Usually writing at <abuse@company.com> is a good place to start.

tasks.title: DA1. Verify
tasks.description:
In conjunction with a senior member of the SOC  
- Double check previous data
- Rule Out False Positive

tasks.title: DA2. Critical Incident
tasks.description: If this incident is deemed **Major or Critical** by the senior analyst go to the [Critical Incident Playbook](https://github.com/socfortress/Playbooks/tree/main/IRP-Critical)

tasks.title: DA6. Update Scope
tasks.description:
- Update lists of affeected
    - Data
    - Endpoints
    - Company Entities
    - Clients

tasks.title: DA8. Scope Validation
tasks.description:
Have all the machines and data been identified? 
If you find futher traces of phishing or new IOCs go back to [Verify Step](README.md#verify).  

When you are done identifying all :  
- Data that was Lost
- Affected Endpoints
- Affected Company Entities
- Affected Customers

And if applicable investigated all:  
- URLs
- Domains
- IP
- Ports
- Files
- Hash

You can proceed with the next steps.

tasks.title: DC3. Compromised or Lost MFA
tasks.description:
If any Multi Factor Authentication token/code were accessed, stolen or used they will all need to be 
- Revoke
- Replace.

tasks.title: DC5. Customer Data
tasks.description: If any if customer data was accessed or leaked we will need to send communication to all affected clients using the approved [Customer Communication Template]().

tasks.title: DC14. New Data Lost Discovered?
tasks.description: If there was new leaked data/devices discovered, go back to the [Analyze Phase](https://github.com/socfortress/Playbooks/tree/main/IRP-DataLoss#3-analyze)

tasks.title: DC11. Attacker Still Have Access?
tasks.description: If there is any sign of the attacker still being in the network, go to the [Malware Playbook](https://github.com/socfortress/Playbooks/tree/main/IRP-Malware)

tasks.title: DR5. All Affected Endpoints Restored?
tasks.description:
If all affected endpoints have been restored, you can go to the **Post Incident** phase, otherwise continue bellow.  
- List systems that haven't been restored

tasks.title: DA5. What Was Accessed
tasks.description:
Did the attack touched other systems?  
Look for:  
- Signs of Lateral Movement
- Review Firewall Logs
- Review Netflows
- Assess the Number of Hosts Involved
- Number of Clients Affected
    - Perform the same research for all affected clients

tasks.title: DC1. Compromised Credentials
tasks.description:
If any credentials are suspected to have been accessed, stolen or used they will all need to be changed.  
This applies to:  
- Local Passwords
- Network Passwords
- Remote Passwords
- Etc.

tasks.title: DD1. Identify Threat Indicators
tasks.description:
#### Alerts
Alerts are be generated by differents systems owned by the Security/SOC team. The main sources for alerts are  
- Tickets
- SIEM
- Anti-Virus / EDR
- Reports
    - DNS
    - Web Proxy

#### Notifications
Notifications are comming from external sources usually via email, Teams or phone. The main sources for notifications are  
- System Administrators
- Clients
- Third Parties
- ISP

tasks.title: DD3. Data Colletion
tasks.description:
Type Data
- Personally identifiable information (PII) 
- Intellectual Property
- Age of the Data 
    - Current
    - Old
- Owner of the Data
    - Company
    - Clients

tasks.title: DD5. Is it Ransomware ?
tasks.description: If the Data Loss is caused by a Ransomware please refere to the ![Ransomware Playbook](https://github.com/socfortress/Playbooks/tree/main/IRP-Ransom)

tasks.title: DC9. Insider Threat
tasks.description:
If the information was intentionally leaked/sold by an employee, we need to:  
- Contact HR
- Disable User Account
- Disable any MFA token

We will potentially need to send physical security to the employee's desk to seize his/her laptop and other devices.
